block.p: Joanna Linda Whitney, the daughter of Gail Whitney and Dana Whitney of Clinton, Conn., was married yesterday at the Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas to Capt. Peter Albert Taczanowsky, a son of Edward Taczanowsky of Oro Valley, Ariz., and the stepson of Amy Taczanowsky. Capt. Dan Urquhart, a Protestant Army chaplain, officiated at the nondenominational ceremony.

Mrs. Taczanowsky, 25, works in Fort Irwin, Calif., as a senior program analyst for Calibre, a management and technology services company on contract to the Defense Department; she is assigned to a team working on the expansion of Fort Irwin, an Army post. She graduated with honors from St. Anselm College in Manchester, N.H.

Joanna Linda Whitney, the daughter of Gail Whitney and Dana Whitney of Clinton, Conn., was married yesterday at the Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas to Capt. Peter Albert Taczanowsky, a son of Edward Taczanowsky of Oro Valley, Ariz., and the stepson of Amy Taczanowsky. Capt. Dan Urquhart, a Protestant Army chaplain, officiated at the nondenominational ceremony.

Joanna Linda Whitney, the daughter of Gail Whitney and Dana Whitney of Clinton, Conn., was married yesterday at the Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas to Capt. Peter Albert Taczanowsky, a son of Edward Taczanowsky of Oro Valley, Ariz., and the stepson of Amy Taczanowsky. Capt. Dan Urquhart, a Protestant Army chaplain, officiated at the nondenominational ceremony.

Mrs. Taczanowsky, 25, works in Fort Irwin, Calif., as a senior program analyst for Calibre, a management and technology services company on contract to the Defense Department; she is assigned to a team working on the expansion of Fort Irwin, an Army post. She graduated with honors from St. Anselm College in Manchester, N.H.

Her father is an arborist and forester in Clinton, who consults for various government agencies and private landowners. Her mother teaches first grade at the Melissa Jones Elementary School in Guilford, Conn.

Captain Taczanowsky, 26, is the rear detachment commander for the 58th Combat Engineer Company, which is stationed at Fort Irwin. From 2004 to 2005, he served in Baghdad. He graduated from West Point.

His father is the president of the Southern Arizona Homebuilders Association, and his stepmother is the executive assistant to the vice president of external relations at University of Arizona, both in Tucson.
